column4: sudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list and uncomment the appropriate lines
then sudo apt-get update
if there is a line for it in /etc/fstab it will automount every time
and Scguy318: I think this is the final answer....how do I edit (where in the file) do I edit fstab?
sudo gedit /etc/fstab  just copy the line for / but change for your new mount
you mean paste this line in there "sudo ntfs-3g /dev/hdc1  /mnt/mountme"?
enable multiverse

thank you for the multiverse comment....that worked. However, when I try to install dvd::rip, I get an error message saying "could not mark all packages for installation or upgrade...following packages have unresolvable dependencies. Make sure that all required repositories are added and enabled in the preferences"
what packages need dependencies?
dvdrip:
does it say waht packages they conflict with?
that is all it lists in there...
do you have universe enabled also?
i usually enable all the ones that are listed, plus i usually end up adding a few more :)
i'm in business...it's downloading now. Thank you!

I do have one more question: I installed K3b. Upon its startup, I get a message:  please install the MAD Mp3 decoding library as well as the K3b MAD Mp3 decoder plugin (the latter may already be installed but not functional due to the missing libmad). I installed package libmad0, but I still get the same error message. Any thoughts?
try install libmad0-dev
and madplay if that still doesnt work
I installed libmad dev and madplay and I still get the same message upon K3b startup
type locate libmad, mine are in /usr/lib dont paste the results here though, youll get kicked
I reinstalled those two packages and it worked!!
